this day brought some stressful situations. I was projecting some anxiety on to what should have been an occasion for joy (catch-up with friends); my best friend, who lives across the country, was going THROUGH a family crisis; my phone broke, which turned into a 2.5 hour ordeal at the Apple store; & I missed my stop for the train, LOL.
when I got back, I was ready as hell to ride the Relaxi Taxi, and I got a little toasty, peeled myself an orange, cracked open a beer...and was about to get out my brand-spankin'-new iPhone 8 to fiddle around, set things up (...and we all know how the spiral goes from there), when I thought... WAIT! Activate!

so, with a little pause and with a little presence, I activated my choice to sit down to write this instead!

It reminded me of the end of this practice, when Adriene is sending us off with her final message, then takes us into that last chair pose - a little push and, in reward, a generous surge of energy.

...sort of like this! This reflective part has been super-fun and rewarding, as it gives me an opportunity to express myself and a fresh lens through which to view the day - I wasn't really intending to "stay" with the theme, but it popped up at just the right time, when I was making an "easy," more unconscious choice that would have ended up with me feeling a bit "blah" and drained in the long run, especially as my relationship with the Internet and devices is a habit I'm trying to manage (consumption vs. creation!). so often, it's the littlest things that can prevent us from starting (i.e. not taking my laptop out of the backpack), but once it's in motion, it's, like, oh, DUH!!! THIS IS WAY BETTER
(...aaaaand can still be enjoyed, even enhanced, with a lil bit o' green, hops, n a healthy snack :))


N A M A S T E to all, and to all a good night!

Like how long it would take to get things done, how forgetful I was getting, how much of my time was being used up. It was a slow process that took me out of myself, and then I would look in the mirror and be shocked at what I saw. Yesterday I awakened and remembered that loathing activates sickness and pain, whereas actively loving brings healing and well- being. So that is how I entered today’s practice! From the first focused breath I activated the energy slowly and lovingly to each joint and muscle! The pace was precisely what I needed and the instruction was wonderful! My mind still likes to think that I can do, what I could do, just four years ago when I was very fit! Remembering and practicing the beginning forms is what will strengthen me and build the flexibility I need. That is what will actively get me to where I want to be. Just yesterday I would have loathed not being able to keep up in high lunge. But today, staying in low lunge, I lovingly focused on breath and form to activate a positive flow of energy within myself and healing. Thank you Adriene!

Day 4 and this is where it starts to get tough to maintain the discipline for daily practice. I'd like to offer this tip to the community. I have two yoga practice times scheduled in my day. Plan A yoga is first thing in the morning when I wake up. This works perfectly well most days. Then there are the times I get in bed late, I have to get the car to the mechanic at 7am, my cat wakes me up three times in a night.... you know how it goes. That's when I go to Plan B yoga. The window of time that works for me is 4-5 in the afternoon after I finish work but before I have to start dinner. I don't schedule any appointments during this time and I arrange my schedule to have that time open. If I missed am yoga, I have this backup plan. Bonus for me is that if I have done my morning yoga, I gain this nice space to read, garden, craft, call a friend, or (let's be honest) troubleshoot some daily crisis, which is a great motivator to do morning yoga! Wishing you all the benefits of regular practice. Love from NC USA.
